admin: Help — Administrator About the bot The bot helps you manage the competition: users, teams, submissions, pages, tracks, and timelines. Your capabilities 1) Add a user (including an administrator). 2) Add a team. 3) Grade a submission. 4) Re-grade a submission. 5) Add a track. 6) Create a competition. 7) View the list of submissions. 8) Add a user to a team. How to quickly register a competition Send a single ZIP archive with the following structure: • In the root: folders english and russian, and a file competition.json. • In each language folder, provide HTML files for every track: - about_{{slug}}.html - rule_{{slug}}.html Example structure: competition.zip ├─ competition.json ├─ english/ │ ├─ about_classic.html │ └─ rule_classic.html └─ russian/ ├─ about_classic.html └─ rule_classic.html Schema of competition.json: • title (str) — competition title • slug (str) — unique competition identifier • start_at (str) — start datetime in format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM (time zone: Moscow) • end_at (str) — end datetime in format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM (time zone: Moscow) • tracks (list[object]) — list of tracks Track object schema: • slug (str) — track identifier • title (str) — track title • max_contestants (int) — maximum number of participants for team • max_submissions_total (int) — total submission limit per track Minimal competition.json example: {{ 'title': 'Smart Challenge 2025', 'slug': 'smart_challenge_2025', 'start_at': '2025-11-15 10:00', 'end_at': '2025-12-15 23:59', 'tracks': [ {{ 'slug': 'classic', 'title': 'Classic Track', 'max_contestants': 5, 'max_submissions_total': 100 }} ] }} HTML files: • For each track, provide a pair of files in both languages: - about_{{slug}}.html — general information - rule_{{slug}}.html — rules • {{slug}} is the track’s slug (e.g., classic). Slug requirements: • Only Latin letters (a–z, A–Z), digits (0–9), and underscore _ are allowed.
contestant: Help — Participant About the bot The bot lets you submit solutions, view the leaderboard, and see competition information. What you can do • View your profile (read-only). • Submit solutions. • View the leaderboard. • View brief information about your submissions. • View the rules of the selected competition and general info about it. How to submit Simply send a single message with your solution as a ZIP archive.
unregistered: Help — Unregistered About the bot You are using the bot without registration, so functionality is limited. Status Submitting solutions, viewing the leaderboard, and accessing competition pages are unavailable until you are registered. What to do Please contact the organizers to be registered in the bot. Available now • Viewing this help.
